# Baby (drag queen)

BABY on the UK Drag Community  GUAP | website=YouTube |url=https://m.youtube.com/watch?si=TBeMQ2-Hi8FKpAdB&v=qZ49Y-jyXsE&feature=youtu.be |language=en|date=November 20, 2020|access-date=October 13, 2023}}

Baby, also known as Hey, Baby and ROM-1, is the stage name of Romone Majik Clarke, an English drag queen who competed on series 4 of RuPaul's Drag Race UK.
Early life and education
Baby is the youngest of five children and graduated from the BRIT School with a degree in songwriting.
Career
Baby competed on series 4 of RuPaul's Drag Race UK''. She describes herself as "London's afro-punk princess". She eliminated herself from the competition, following a bottom two placement and a lip-sync against Dakota Schiffer. According to Gay Times, Baby left "after opening up about their battle with depression and anxiety, igniting a vital conversation about mental health in the process". Baby appeared in music videos for "Unholy" by Sam Smith and Kim Petras as well as "Hot in It" by Tiësto and Charli XCX. Baby released the single "Theatre!" in 2023.
Personal life
Baby is based in London. She cites her major drag inspirations to be Crystal LaBeija, Pepper LaBeija and Shea Couleé.
